landmarks.title: Rheinturm
landmarks.shortDescription: A 240.5-meter telecommunications tower offering panoramic views of Düsseldorf and the Rhine River, featuring a revolving restaurant and observation deck.

landmarks.title: Königsallee
landmarks.shortDescription: One of Europe's most luxurious shopping streets, lined with high-end boutiques, designer stores, and elegant tree-lined canals.

landmarks.title: Altstadt (Old Town)
landmarks.shortDescription: The historic heart of Düsseldorf, known as 'the longest bar in the world' with over 300 bars, restaurants, and breweries in a compact area.

landmarks.title: Schloss Benrath
landmarks.shortDescription: An 18th-century baroque palace with beautiful gardens, now housing museums showcasing European garden art and natural history.

landmarks.title: MedienHafen
landmarks.shortDescription: A modern harbor district featuring cutting-edge architecture by renowned architects like Frank Gehry, with the iconic Gehry buildings as highlights.

landmarks.title: St. Lambertus Basilica
landmarks.shortDescription: A medieval church with a distinctive twisted spire, legend says it twisted when an unworthy person was buried there.

landmarks.title: Rhine Promenade
landmarks.shortDescription: A scenic waterfront walkway along the Rhine River, perfect for strolling, cycling, and enjoying views of the old town and river traffic.

landmarks.title: Kunstsammlung Nordrhein-Westfalen
landmarks.shortDescription: A renowned art museum complex featuring modern and contemporary art, including works by Picasso, Klee, and other masters.

landmarks.title: Japanese Quarter
landmarks.shortDescription: The largest Japanese community in Germany, offering authentic restaurants, shops, and the beautiful EKŌ-Haus Japanese cultural center.

landmarks.title: Carlsplatz Market
landmarks.shortDescription: Düsseldorf's oldest market square, featuring fresh local produce, flowers, and specialty foods in a charming historic setting.
